Title: GPC - License Renewals, Teradici Software Renewal, and Wireless Charges
Justification: Operation and Maintenance requirements include software license annual renewals (Solar Winds Module (tracking IP addresses), CBT Nuggets, Solar Winds Server & Application Monitor/Event Manager$25K, Nutanix SIPR VDI Hardware $25K, Nutanix SIPR Server Virtualization $25K, Nutanix NIPR Server Virtualization $25K, Dell Storage Center Maintenance for NIPR $25K/ SIPR $25K- both Dell maintenance support items). The annual Desktop All Access Subscription provides a license for the PCoIP (PC over IP) Management Console Enterprise.  The license for this console expires each year and disables the console.  This console is used to manage the 750 Zero client devices on the Secret Internet Protocol Router Network (SIPRNET).  Specifically the subscription provides access to the latest firmware updates for the Zero Client devices. These updates close security vulnerabilities and provide feature updates needed to operate the virtual desktop environment.  When new SIPRNET tokens are introduced, some are not compatible with the current firmware release. This breaks SIPRNET capability for users that have received new tokens until the firmware for the Zero Client device has been updated to provide compatibility.  The Enterprise Console allows 2 CS to push the updates to all online Zero clients quickly. Without the console, each Zero Client device would have to be manually updated, taking hundreds of staffing hours.  Additionally, without the subscription, the updated firmware may not be available for download, preventing users with new tokens from performing their mission. GPC for 2 CS Wireless devices, Standby, CC  Staff, Shirt, Chief, and Exec Comm.
Impact if not Funded: Communications squadron will not be able to maintain communications services for the base. Title: PPE
Justification: Personnel Protective Equipment purchases include safety toe boots, coveralls, work gloves, hearing protection, reflective belts, safety glasses, and camelbacks for 650 personnel. Personnel are mandated to wear proper PPE items when performing primary duties (AFI 21-101, OSHA 1910.95, OSHA 1910.136, and Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970).  Safety toe boots, work gloves and coveralls carry the highest wear-out rate and tend to get issued multiple times to an individual.  Cold/wet weather gear is required for BAFB flight line operations and B-52 missions worldwide.  Cold/wet weather gear such as fleece and APECS items are issued to personnel.  The mandatory wear date for the OCP uniform is April 2021, requiring an additional 100% issue of OCP wet weather gear.
Impact if not Funded: Personnel will be affected by weather leading to sickness.  Additionally exposure to loud noise and industrial area hazards can lead to physical injuries or death.  On average, Barksdale receives rain 127/365 days a year and temperatures during the months Dec through Mar range 38 - 59 degrees Fahrenheit.  Without rain gear/cold weather gear, Barksdale would be unable to launch or work on aircraft during these times.

Title: Mission TDY

Title: VEHICLE FUEL
Justification: Ground fuel used to transport personnel, equipment, tools, and AGE equipment from workcenters to aircraft on the flightline
Impact if not Funded: Lack of funding will result in the inability for 2d Bomb Wing to maintain the Fully Mission Capable rate of the B-52 mission.  AGE equipment, which is required to provide air, power, liquid oxygen, nitrogen, and air conditioning to the B-52 during maintenance, servicing, and prep for take off, will not be able to be delivered the average distance of 1 mile from the AGE shop to the locations on the flightline because the equipment requires an average of three personnel.  For a crew of four personnel to walk from their shop (pushing heavy tool boxes and maintenance stands) would take minimum of 20 minutes versus 5 minutes and this reults in loss of 2 manhours for each job.

Title: Vehicle Thermal Imagers

Title: Tank Entry Stands
Justification: FUELS TECHNICIANS DO NOT HAVE THE MEANS TO SAFELY ENTER AND EXIT AIRCRAFT FUEL TANKS.  WHEN PERSONNEL USE LADDERS THEY HAVE TO STAND ON TOP RUNG WHICH IS A SAFETY/AFI VIOLATION.  ADDITIONALLY, PERSONNEL ARE PROHIBITED FROM CARRYING TOOLS UP AND DOWN LADDERS.  WHEN B-4 STANDS ARE USED THEY HAVE TO STAND ON RAILS TO ENTER TANKS WHICH IS A VIOLATION OF AFI91-203 PAR 7.2.1.6.1.1.  THESE CUSTOM DESIGNED STANDS WILL ALLOW PERSONNEL TO SAFELY ENTER TANKS IAW AFI'S AND WILL ALLEVIATE EMERGENCY TANK EXTRACTIONS.  A B-4 STAND PLATFORM’S SIZE RESTRICTS 1ST RESPONDERS FROM EXTRACTING PERSONNEL FROM CONFINED SPACES.
Impact if not Funded: FUEL CELL MX WILL NOT BE SAFELY OR AFI DRIVEN COMPLIANT. AGE STANDS INCURR HIGHER DAMAGE RATES/REPAIR ACTIONS WHICH BOG DOWN AGE AND FAB FLIGHTS WITH UNNECESSARY MX. CUMBERSOME BURDEN ADDED TO ALL THREE FLIGHTS TO WORK AROUND INADEQUATE EQUIPMENT.  WITHOUT THESE STANDS, IT IS A MATTER OF TIME WHEN SOMEONE IS INJURED/INCAPACITATED WHILE PERFORMING MAINTENANCE INSIDE THE FUEL TANK, AND FIRST RESPONDERS MAY NOT BE ABLE TO EXTRACT PERSONNEL IN TIME, RESULTING IN A FATALITY FOR THE WING.

The MPF is no longer printing award and retirement certificates, and this responsibility has been shifted down to the group and squadron level.  Monitors for the desktop computers and laptops is not part of the base tech refresh schedule and require replacement every few years.  Scanners are required to scan documents that are required to be sent electronically.  The desired plan is to get the printers assigned to 2 MXG on a 4-year replacement schedule where the repairs will be covered under warranty from the manufacturer.
Impact if not Funded: 2 MXG will have to continue repairing the current printers until they are no longer repairable, which would cause misuse of taxpayer dollars since a 4-year replacement schedule could be established and repairs would be accomplished under warranty.
